elements.title: flag of Duluth, Minnesota (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the flag of Duluth, Minnesota (pictured), has an award-winning simple design, but still represents eight things including Lake Superior, the North Woods, and three city hills?

elements.title: Sophie Scamps (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sophie Scamps decided to enter politics after a survey from her local member of parliament failed to mention climate change?

elements.title: Vollpension (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Vollpension employs grandparents to bake cakes according to their own recipes and, during the COVID-19 pandemic, offered live baking courses from elders around the world?

elements.title: Benjamin F. McAdoo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Benjamin F. McAdoo was the first Black architect to be licensed in the U.S. state of Washington?

elements.title: Taste (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sabrina Carpenter and Jenna Ortega kiss in the music video for "Taste"?

elements.title: Quinto Inuma Alvarado (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the week of his assassination, Quinto Inuma Alvarado said at a conference: "If I must die, I will die"?

elements.title: G Affairs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that G Affairs was presented at project markets in South Korea, Taiwan, and Hong Kong, but rejected because it was deemed unmarketable in China?

elements.title: Sienna Green (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sienna Green began playing water polo because she saw it as a combination of basketball and swimming, her favourite sports?

elements.title: a parrot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a parrot reportedly screamed profanities at the funeral of U.S. president Andrew Jackson?
